direction.raw_text: A small bare room, illuminated only by the streetlight coming through the window. A hand presses a cassette into a recorder and fiddles with a small microphone. Malloy sits over a table fiddling with the tape. He is young, half-shaven, dressed in T-shirt and jeans. He looks too -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who stands by the window, looking out on the street, with his back to Malloy. Louis is dressed in an old-fashioned suit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you want me to tell you the story of my life...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what I do. I interview people. I collect lives. F.M. radio. F.F.R.C. I just interviewed a genuine hero, a cop who -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd have to have a lot of tape for my story. I've had a very unusual life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So much the better. I've got a pocket full of tapes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You followed me here, didn't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Saw you in the street outside. You seemed interesting. Is this where you live?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just a room...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So shall we begin? (playfully, almost teasing) What do you do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a vampire. Malloy laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See? I knew you were interesting. You mean this literally, I take it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely. I was watching you watching me. I was waiting for you in that alleyway. And then you began to speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, what a lucky break for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps lucky for both of us. Still in shadow he turns from the window and approaches the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell you my story. All of it. I'd like to do that very much. Malloy is uneasy as he studies the shadowy figure, fascinated but afraid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were going to kill me? Drink my blood?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes but you needn't worry about that now. Things change. Louis stands opposite, hand on the chair. Malloy is riveted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You believe this, don't you? That you're a vampire? You really think...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't begin this way. Let me turn on the light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I thought vampires didn't like the light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We love it. I only wanted to prepare you. Louis pulls the chord of the overhead naked light bulb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Appears inhumanly white, eyes glittering. Inhuman or not alive. the effect is subtle, beautiful and ghastly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good God! He struggles to suppress fear and understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be frightened. I want this opportunity. The light appears to go out by itself and suddenly Louis is in the chair, dimly lit by the street-light from the window. The cassette is turning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The same way you do it. A series of simple gestures. Only I moved too fast for you to see. I'm flesh and blood, you see. But not human. I haven't been human for two hundred years. Malloy is speechless, frightened yet enthralled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What can I do to put you at ease? Shall we begin like David Copperfield? I am born, I grow up. Or shall we begin when I was born to darkness, as I call it. That's really where we should start, don't you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not lying to me, are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why should I lie? 1791 was the year it happened. I was twenty-four - younger than you are now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But times were different then. I was a man at that age. The master of a large plantation just south of New Orleans...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A disheveled Louis, hair in pigtail, in deep pocket frock coat, rides his horse through the fields of indigo, passing an overseer and slaves at work. He passes slave quarters and the distant colonial mansion of Pointe du Lac. He comes to a small parish church and a graveyard. he dismounts and walks through the tombs to an elaborate one in Greek Style.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had just lost my wife in childbirth. She and the infant had been buried less than half a year. There is a marble angel above the tomb, feminine, with a tiny cherub angel in her arms. Louis looks from the angel, down to the inscriptions on the tomb:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - 1791 INFANT JEAN MARIE - 1791" Louis rips away the vines already covering the inscription, then drinks from a pocket-flask. His face is ashen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was twenty-four and life seemed finished. I couldn't bear the pain of their loss. I longed for a release from it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis in ragged lace and dirty brocade sitting between two whores at a gaming table, drinking absinthe. All around him flatboatmen, whores, gamblers, black African freedmen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanted to lose everything. My wealth, my estate, my sanity. But Lady Luck didn't oblige. Louis displays a hand of four aces. A gambler at the table stands in fury, over turning money, cards, drinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're calling me a cheat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm calling you a piece of shit - The Gambler pulls out a pearl-handled pistol and points it at Louis. The crowd hushes and draws back. Louis smiles drunkenly and stands. he rips open his lace shirt, exposing his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then do me a favor. Get rid of this piece of shit... The Gambler's finger on the trigger. His hand shakes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You lack the courage of your convictions, sir. Do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a hooded figure in the corner, smiles from beneath the shadow of his hood. Gleaming blue eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Most of all I longed for death. I know that now. I invited it, a release from the pain of living... The Gambler lowers his gun, scowling. Louis pockets the fistfulls of coins he has won.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Loud, crowded riverfront taverns full of ruffians. Louis staggers down, an arm around a whore, drinking from a bottle. A pockmarked pimp follows behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My invitation was open to anyone. Sailors, thieves, whores and slaves...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis, quite insensible, being propped up against a wall by the whore in a dank wharf over the water. The pimp rifles his pockets, then pulls a knife, about to slice his throat, when a shadow falls over him. He turns, and we see the face of Lestat, who lifts him into the air by his throat, breaking his neck. the whore screams and Lestat's other hand clamps over her mouth. Lestat drags her towards him. Louis falls to the ground, supported no more, insensible. Close on his face, as we hear the last breaths of life of the whore, off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it was a vampire that accepted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bodies of the thief and whore float by. Above on the wharf, Louis, now awake, stares down at them. He turns, to see Lestat, towering above him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They would have killed you -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then my luck would have changed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want death? Is it death you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... Lestat floats down on top of him, then lifts him in the air, draws his head back by the hair and sinks his teeth in his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every muscle rigid, teeth clenched, as the blood is drained from him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hovering above the ground, like two quivering dancers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: billows through the ghostly white sails and rigging of the boats around the wharf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Floats higher, with Louis in his arms, draining his blood. One hand reaches out and grips a rope, hanging from a shipmast. The other holds Louis. He withdraws his teeth, and looks into Louis' drained face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You still want death? Or have you tasted it enough? Louis can barely get the words out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enough... Lestat smiles and lets him go. Louis falls and plummets into the water below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coming to the surface, in the water lapping by the wharf. The bodies of the whore and thief float beside him. He looks up and sees Lestat way above him, dangling from the rope of the shipmast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captivated, terrified, enthralled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's how it happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. The Gift of Darkness requires more than that, as you'll see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis floating by mudflats, surrounded by dead fish, the carcasses of animals, eighteenth century rubbish. He gets to his feet and walks weakly through the mudflats. The sun is coming up over the sea behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He left me half dead that morning. he wanted something from me. He came back the following night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis is delirious in a four-poster bed, shrouded with mosquito netting. A female slave, YVETTE, bathes his face with a rag. She is crying. Other slave women hover in the shadows. Yvette puts out all candles save one by the bed, and withdraws, with the others. Candlelight flickers on the face of the bisque virgin. Louis tosses and turns, dreaming, murmuring incoherently. Then he opens his eyes.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: INT.
location: LAVISH FRENCH-FURNISHED BEDROOM AT POINT DU LAC

direction.raw_text: exquisitely dressed in French clothing, stands by the bed smiling. In the light of the candle we see that he is not human; skin too white; eyes too bright. Lestat looks amiable, even mischievous, but impossible - and angel or monster. Louis grabs his pistol from the table and cocks it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who the hell are you? What are you doing in my house?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And a beautiful house it is too. Yours is a good life, isn't it? Louis takes aim. Lestat puts his hand over the barrel. Louis fires. The bullet tears a hole in Lestat's hand. Lestat is unfazed. He takes the gun from Louis' hand and throws it away. His hand begins to heal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not afraid of anything, are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why should I be? Louis reaches for his sword, hanging by the bed, and point it. Lestat laughs indulgently. He draws closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you going to put that through me too? Ruin my beautiful clothes? He comes closer to Louis, right up to his face, so the sword passes through his waistcoat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were all last night's promises for nothing? He reaches out with his now-healed hand and plucks out the sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want from me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've come to answer your prayers. You want to die, don't you? Life has no meaning anymore, does it? Lestat sits down on the bed, drawing up one knee. Louis is becoming spellbound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wine has no taste. The food sickens you. There seems no reason for any of it, does there? But what if I could give it back to you? Pluck out the pain and give you another life? And it would be for all time? And sickness and death could never touch you again? The vampire theme rises, with the sound of a heartbeat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The camera drifts through the graveyard where Louis' wife is buring. Everything is lit with an eerie glow, as if seen through some unearthly eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vampires, that's what we are. Creatures of darkness, only we see it that darkness more clearly than any mortal has ever seen... Louis and Lestat drifting, dreamlike, through the overhanging vines, comes to the grave of his wife and child. Above the crypt, the statue of angel, mother and child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wouldn't it be sweet to bid pain goodbye? To wave away anguish and grief? To embrace the peace of the unending night? The marble fingers of the child on the statue move. The angel raises her head and has the face of Louis wife, Diane. she raises her hand and touches Louis tear- streamed face. The child speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Papa... Louis reaches out to embrace them and finds himself touching cold marble. He cries out in anguish-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diane!!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are gone, Louis. Death took them. Death which you can now destroy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis, thrashing on the bed in a delirium. Lestat places a hand on his forehead and soothes him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to ask me for this. You have to want it, do you hear me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give it to me!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vampires. We thrive on blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want it! Lestat bends close as if to drink Louis' blood. Louis does not shrink back, but stares into his eyes. Lestat draws back, then stands up and goes to the French doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tomorrow night. You must prove yourself. I will give you the choice I never had. He looks outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sun's coming up. Watch it carefully. If you come with me tomorrow, you'll never see it again. He leaves. Louis sits dazed, staring at the empty French window. The sun rises with unnatural beauty, over the swamplands and the plantation, filling the room, striking water-pitcher, glass, mirror, and the picture of his dead wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My last sunrise. That morning I was not yet a vampire, and I saw my last sunrise. I remember it completely, yet I don't remember any sunrise before it. I watched the whole magnificence of the dawn for the last time, as if it were the first. And the I said goodbye to sunlight and went out to become what I became.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lestat and Louis walk through the slave quarters, huddles groups around fires, music, singing. The sound of whipping is heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your grief has unhinged you. You've let your estate rot. In the woods beyond the quarters, the white overseer is whipping a black slave, with horrifying savagery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You let your overseer run riot, work your slaves to the bone. We'll start with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you mean, start?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call him. Louis calls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carlos!!! The overseer turns and comes towards them, with the bloodied whip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why the bloody whip, Carlos? The overseer looks into his eyes, shivers with terror, drops the whip and runs for the trees. Lestat is on him in an instant. He sinks is teeth in his neck. Louis runs to him, tries to pull him off. But Lestat turns to Louis and smiles, with his bloodied mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's call that a start.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've just done it -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill me if you will, but I can't do this... He flees, as Lestat ends to finish off the overseer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis running up the steps leading to the gallery. He is crazed with guilt. He looks up and sees -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sitting collected at the head of the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Backs away as Lestat rises and descends the steps so fluidly he hardly seems to move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry. He was white trash, they come at two a penny. I dumped him in the swamp and untied the slave, licked his wounds clean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the devil, aren't you? That's who you are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish I were. But if I were, what would I want with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't go through with it, I tell you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your perfect. Your bitter and you're strong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But why do you want me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you're as strong as I was when I was alive. Louis takes out his flask and drinks. Drunkenly, he turns and heads for a nearby swamp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis stops again in front of the crypt. Drinks from the flask, leans his forehead against the stone. Lestat appears beside him, radiant, beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really want to be with them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Kill me. Kill me like you promised -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You asked for death. I didn't promise it - In a quiet rage, Lestat raise his fist and shatters the marble face stone, revealing a coffin below. His fist shatters that in turn, revealing the half-rotted body of a women, holding an infant, no longer recognizable as individuals, a tangle of gruesome rotted hair, flesh, eaten away lace, insects and worms crawling over it. Louis gasps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not your wife and child my friend. It's death. Just that simple. Think and choose. It happens to everyone. Except us. Lestat stares at him, smiling, becoming a hazy dreamlike vision, then hyperclear. Louis again is spellbound. He drops the flask, which shatters on the stones. Lestat appears angelic in his radiance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We shall be this way always, my friend. Young as we are now. I'm lonely for a companion, lonely for your strength. But I'm not that lonely. Do you want to come or not? Louis capitulates in one long sigh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... Lestat comes closer, smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did I hear a yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... Lestat embraces Louis, obscuring his face. He drinks his blood. We hear two heartbeats, out of sync, coming together. We see Louis' face, growing paler, paler, as his blood is drained. His eyes stare upwards, losing their focus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The moon, through hanging vines. The marble statue of his wife and child smile at him, as if come alive. Her hair blows in the breeze, wonderful gold tresses, the child's fingers reach out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lestat lets Louis fall down beside the broken crypt. Louis looks from the rotting bodies to Lestat above him. radiant. Lestat speaks gently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've drained you to the point of death. If you drink from me you live for ever. If I leave you here you die. Lestat lifts his hand to his lips and blows Louis a kiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Don't leave me here. Give it to me. Lestat lifts his own right wrist to his teeth. Fangs slash his own flesh, blood falls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure... Louis rises to accept the first drops with his open mouth. Lestat gathers him up, as Louis clamps his hand on Lestat's arm and drinks from the wrist. The VAMPIRE THEME swells. Lestat watches him drink his wrist with wry amusement. Louis finishes, staggers away from him as if drunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vampire vision. The world is transformed, the swamp, the moon, the clouds, the cry of the night birds all come to him with unnatural clarity. He looks down with pity at the corpses of his wife and child who appear beautiful in death now rather than repulsive. He closes the lid of the coffin and replaces it in the ground, astonished at the ease of it. He turns and stares at Lestat whom he sees now with vampire's vision. Lestat's eyes are brighter, his buttons are glimmering in the light. Everything is clearer, brighter, containing more facets of light and color.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop staring at my buttons. Didn't I tell you it was going to be fun? Lestat leads him into the swamp. Everything astonished Louis, as if he's never seen it before. Louis is suddenly racked by shudders of pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're body's dying. Pay no attention. It will take twenty minutes at most.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dying? Louis dry-retches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It happens to us all. Lestat wipes Louis' brow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come, you're going to feed now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want a woman. Lestat laughs and his laughter echoes like bells in Louis' ears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That doesn't matter anymore, Louis. You'll see. Come...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Small high ground. Camp of runaway slaves. Several share a bottle of rum around the fire. A male slave rises. A gorgeous hunk of flesh in the moonlight and goes into the swamp to relieve his bladder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're all beautiful now. Men, women, the old, the young...simply because they are alive. - The slave walks towards them in the darkness. A crucifix gleams round his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crucifix -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget the crucifix. Take him. Louis hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Resist no more Louis. Feed... The slave looks up and sees them. Two gleaming white beings standing before him with devil's eyes. The he runs. Louis can resist him no more. He swoops on him with a vampire's rapid movement, brings him to the ground and sinks his teeth in his neck. Close on Louis feeding on the slave, the magnificent body shuddering in its death-throes. Lestat stands above, laughing. The slave dies. Louis rises from him, drunkenly, engorged with blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What have I done?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have fed. You were made for this... Louis looks down at the body of the slave. Lestat's laughter echoes around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dear God, what have I done?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've killed Louis. And enjoyed it. Lestat laughs harder. Louis runs from him, screaming in anguish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis reaches his wife's grave. He falls to his knees, throws back his head and bares his new fangs to the moon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dear God, what have I become????
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SAN FRANCISCO - NIGHT Malloy stares at Louis, terrified and enthralled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said the slave had a crucifix...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, that rumor about crosses?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't look at them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nonsense, my friend. I can look on anything I like. And I am particularly fond of looking on crucifixes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The story about stakes through the heart?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The same. As you would say today... Bull shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about coffins?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coffins... coffins unfortunately are a necessity...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis walks up the steps to the mansion. He looks now like a fully-fledged vampire. Yvette, the slave girl stares at him from the open doorway. Cascades of harpsichord music come from the interior.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Killing is no ordinary act. It is the experience of another's life for certain. That night I had lost my own life and taken another's. I was drowning in a sea of human guilt and regret, with all the heightened senses of a vampire... Louis enters the mansion, following the harpsichord music, as if in a dream. Yvette draws back as he approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis wanders into the parlor, where Lestat is playing the harpsichord rapidly and exuberantly. Louis goes to a full-length mirror and sees his own reflection there - quite the perfect vampire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, that's you, my handsome friend. And you'll look that way till the stars fall from heaven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It can't be...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give it time. You're like a man who loses a limb and still imagines he feels pain. It will pass. And we must sleep now. I can feel the sun approaching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dawn spreading over the plantation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A brick walled storage room. Two coffins stand on the floor. Lestat enters with a lantern, Louis behind. Lestat is apprehensive and protective of Louis. He pulls back one lid ot reveal a satin interior.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must get into it. It's the only safe place for you when the light comes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if I don't?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sun will destroy the blood I've given you. Every tissue, every vein. The fire in this lantern could do that too. Louis approaches the coffin, hands trembling as he peers into it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be afraid. In moments you'll be sleeping as soundly as you ever slept. And when you awake I'll be waiting for you, and so will all the world. Louis crawls into the coffin, fearful yet fascinated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You told me something earlier. You said you didn't have a choice. Was that true? Lestat smiles bitterly and nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someday I'll tell you. We have a lot of time to talk to each other. You might say... we have all the time we shall ever need. He closes the lid. Total darkness. Sounds of Louis' panicked breathing. Of his prayer again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dear God, what have I done?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis and Lestat sitting at a sumptuous table, piled with uneaten food. Lestat is going through sheafs of documents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I awoke the next evening to a different world. And I realized there are as profound differences between vampires as between human beings... Lestat, totting up figures on a piece of paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your wealth, dear Louis, is inestimable. Your income from cotton alone will keep us in comfort for a century. Louis just stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I sat there staring at him with contempt. He had the soul of a shopkeeper, he was the sow's ear out of which nothing fine could be made. I felt sadly cheated in having him as a teacher... Lestat looks up at him and grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll get used to killing. Just forget about that mortal coil. You'll become accustomed to things all too quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think so? Yvette enters, stands behind him, staring at Lestat with loathing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are not hungry, sir...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Au contraire, my dear. He could eat a horse... Lestat laughs loudly. Louis turns and looks at Yvette. Her beautiful forehead in the candlelight, the veins pulsing on her neck and her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I looked at anything mortal and saw all life as precious, condemning all fruitless guilt and passion that would let it slip through the fingers like sand... Yvette returns his stare, troubled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was only as a vampire that I could see Yvette's beauty. Her fear of me increased my desire. Yvette reaches for his uneaten plate. Louis stops her hand. Holds it for a beat too long, looking at the veins in her wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will finish it, Yvette. Now leave us. She turns and runs from the table. Lestat leans towards him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't you pretend, you fool? Don't give the game away. We're lucky to have such a home. His hand snakes out under the table. It comes up holding a large grey rat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretend to drink, at least. He bares his fangs and slices the rat's throat. He pours the blood into a crystal glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Such fine crystal shouldn't go to waste... He hands the glass to Louis. Louis drinks the blood and stares at it in surprise, then at the dead rat on the fine lace tablecloth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. It gets cold so fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can live like this? Off the blood of animals? Lestat shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't call it living. I'd call it surviving. A useful trick if you're caught for a month on a ship at sea. Lestat strokes the belly of the dead rat, studying it sadly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's nothing in the world now that doesn't hold some...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fascination...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. And I'm bored with this prattle - He throws the rat away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But we can live without taking human life. It's possible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything is possible. But just try it for a week. Come into New Orleans and let me show you some real sport! He rises. Louis follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A big, lavish drinking place with a raised stage. Italian actors in buffoonish costumes act crude commedia dell'arte on the stage. Plantation owners in soiled brocade, lace, crooked wigs watch the show as tavern wenches move about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This was New Orleans, a magical and magnificent place to live. In which a vampire, richly dressed might attract no more notice in the evening than hundreds of other exotic creatures. Louis and Lestat by a table, in the shadow of a tree. Teresa, a tavern wench, sits on Lestat's lap, pouring drinks for the two of them. She lifts a fresh glass to Lestat's lips as he flirts with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, mon cher. The best in the colony. Once you touch this you'll never go to any other tavern again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think so, cherie? But what if I'd rather taste your lips?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My lips are even sweeter still... She kisses him. He lets his tongue play with hers, then runs it down her neck. She swoons with pleasure. Then he sinks his teeth gently in her neck, looking playfully behind at Louis, who if appalled and fascinated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laughter rocks the tavern. Lestat slips the pale and dead Teresa into a chair beside him and folds her hands on the table. No one notices. He lays gold coins on the table and touches Louis' knee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's get out of here! Lestat rushes out, thrilled with himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A crowded street. Louis and Lestat emerge from the tavern. Louis looks up at the moon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you ever been caught?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course not. It's so easy you almost feel sorry for them. They walk down the crowded night street, full of ladies in their finery, freed slaves, whores, sailors etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lestat killed two, sometimes three a night. A fresh young girl, that was his favorite for the first of the evening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Small orchestra plays for colonial couples in fine wig and garb prancing to a French minuet. Young women sit in chairs along the walls with their chaperones. Young men stand opposite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the triumphant kill of Lestat was a young man. They represented the greatest loss to Lestat because they stood on the threshold of the maximum possibility of life. A youth of preternatural beauty, silhouetted against French windows. He is talking to an elegant widow, seated, holding two manicured poodles. Lestat stares at the youth with longing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The trick is not to think about it. See that one? The widow St. Clair? she had that gorgeous young fop murder her husband. She's perfect for you. Go ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But how do you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Read her thoughts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dark gift is different for each of us. But one thing is true of everyone. We grow stronger as we go along. He leads Louis closer to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take my word for it. She blamed a slave for his murder. And do you know what they did to him? He smiles at the young man, who smiles in return.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The evildoers are easier. And they taste better...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lestat walks the youth towards a copse of trees. He looks back at Louis, who holds both poodles on a delicate leash, walking with the widow. The minuet spills from the french windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, young man, you really amaze me! I'm old enough to be your grandmother. She leans towards him concquettishly. Louis, crazed with hunger, sees her as beautiful in the moonlight. He allows her lips reach his. He takes her in his arms, gently, romantically, and sinks in his teeth. She swoons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, that's the melody, I remember it. Oh yes... Louis draws his lips away. She is weak in his arms, but still alive. He can't do it. The poodles growl. He shoots out an arm and grabs one, then the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lestat, bending over the body of the dead youth. A scream pierces the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Murder!!! Murderer!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT The widow on the grass, her poodles dead beside her. Louis is trying to quiet her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My little papillions! My butterflies!!! He killed them!!! Lestat comes from nowhere, claps a hand over her mouth and breaks her neck. He spits in fury at Louis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You whining coward of a vampire who prowls the night killing rats and poodles. You could have finished us both! Louis throws himself on Lestat with extraordinary force, pummeling him towards the trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What have you done to me? You've condemned me to hell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know any hell - Louis hurls him against tree after tree with a strength he never knew he had.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to see me kill? Watch me kill you then - He drags him to the ground an throttles him. Lestat looks up at him, amazed and amused at the same time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What strength, my friend, what strength. I remember why I chose you now. Lestat squirms from his grip, seemingly effortlessly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you can't kill me, Louis. Nor I you. He ruffles Louis' hair, with wry affection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Feed on what you want, mon cherie. Rats, chickens, doves, goats. I'll leave you to it and watch you come round. Just remember, life without me would be even more unbearable... He smiles. A sly, pleasurable secret secret smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Their carriage draws up to the mansion as the first fingers of light spread across the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Being a vampire to him meant revenge. Revenge against life- itself. Every time he took a life it was revenge. and the slaves with a wisdom that was denied their masters, began to notice...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a tiny cabin, a slave family. Kids sleeping on the floor, in cribs and cots. The parents sleep on the bed, young, beautiful, naked. Beside them is Lestat, who is drinking the husband's blood, his hand playing across the breast of the wife as he does so. She murmurs in her sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... please... She grabs his fingers and kisses them, thinking him to be her husband. Lestat gently disengages himself and leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The woman's scream pierces the sky, as Lestat walks into the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every chicken is dead, bloodies necks hanging down from the cribs. Louis emerges from the entrance, blood on his lips. He hears the scream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SLAVE QUARTER - NIGHT The sound of drumming is heard, African, primal. The woman runs through the quarters, screaming grief. Others gather at doorways, restrain and console her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beautiful, elaborate eighteenth century dove-cote. Every dove inside is dead, pierced at the neck. A black hand throws in a flaming torch and it bursts into flame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A doll, made in the image of Lestat, is pierced with needles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bodies of slaves floating in the swamp, with the bodies of goats. Slaves at the edge throw ropes around the bodies, pull them towards the shore. The drumming grows louder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis walking through. The slaves hush as he approaches, gather in doorways and whisper. He turns and looks at them, sorrowfully. He looks truly like a ghost. Their eyes turn away when they meet his. He walks on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lestat and Louis sit at the table, the untouched food between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Consider yourself lucky. In Paris a vampire has to be clever for many reasons. Here all one needs is a pair of fangs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paris? You came from Paris?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As did the one who made me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me about him. You must have learnt something from him! It had to happen for you as it did for me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I learnt absolutely nothing. I wasn't give a choice, remember?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you must know something about the meaning of it all, you must know where we come from, why we... Lestat spits out in anger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? Why should I know these things? Do you know them? The drumming grows outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That noise! It's driving me mad! We've been in the country for weeks, with nothing but that noise!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They know about us. They see us dine on empty plates and drink from empty glasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come the New Orleans then. There's an opera on tonight. A real french opera! We can dine in splendor!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I respect life, don't you see? For each and every human life I have respect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Respect me a little then. I'm the only life you know. Louis stares. Lestat turns childishly, petulantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll soon run out of chickens, Louis... He walks out, humming a French aria. Louis stares at his plate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The slaves, gathered on mass around fires. Frenzied drumming, dancing. Lestat rides through, scattering the flames. The drumming stops. The slaves look towards the house. Slowly, they begin to move towards it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis, sitting in despair by the table. Yvette, the slave girl enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Michi Louis? You don't want any supper? Louis laughs harshly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, ma cher. I need no supper. Is all well at Pointe Du Lac tonight? Yvette draws closer. Light reveals her beauty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We worry about you master. When do you ride about the fields? How long since you've been to the slave quarters? Everywhere there is death. Animals, men. Are you our master still at all? Louis watches her sadly. He's getting hungry. Her throat is long and slender, her breasts are gorgeous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave me alone now, Yvette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will not go unless you listen to me. Send away this new friend of yours. The slaves are frightened of him. They are frightened of you. She comes closer, and he can hear her beating heart. She touches his hair. He takes her hand and brings it to his lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am frightened of myself, Yvette. He kisses her wrist. She suddenly gasps, sharply, withdraws her hand. She sees her wrist is red with blood. She sees the blood on his lips. She screams. Louis stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hush, Yvette - She screams even louder. Louis clamps his hand over her mouth. Her hand grips the table-cloth, pulls, bringing the empty glasses and crockery to the floor. In horror, Louis realizes he has broken her neck. He brings her cut wrist to his lips, then drops it, revolted. He carries her body outside, grief-stricken. The drumming grows louder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fires burning in the distance, round the slave-cabins. The slaves are gathered at the foot of the mansion steps. They see Louis come out, holding the body of Yvette. He is deranged with grief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This place is cursed. Damned, do you hear me? And your master is the devil. He places the body of Yvette in a rocking chair on the veranda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out while you can. You're free men. They don't move. They stare at him blankly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unlike me, you are no free men... He turns behind him, and looks at the mansion, all candelabra and chandeliers lighted, all windows open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I have to convince you? He rushed up the stairs, snatches up the candelabra and sets fire to the drapes. He goes from window to window, lighting drapes, lace curtains, everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Setting fire to the house. They rush up the stairs with shouts of "STOP HIM, HE'S MAD". A wall of flame gushes out from the interior, blocking their way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis, wandering from room to room of the burning mansion. he sees paintings of his wife consumed by the flames. He is weakening with the fumes, the heat. We can see this in his face, the texture of his skin. Suddenly a large french window cascades inwards and Lestat stands there, whip in hand. Behind him we can see the morning sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You fool, what have you done?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you wouldn't do. It's almost sunrise. It will be the sun or the fire. You said they can kill me. The sun or the fire! Louis stands there, weakened, then collapses onto the floor. Lestat darts forward and catches him before he drops. He runs out the shattered window, carrying him on his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With many crypts. Louis, unconscious, carried over Lestat's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darkness. Louis lying on the floor of a large crypt. He slowly comes to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where do you think, my idiot friend? We're in a nice filthy cemetery. Does this make you happy? Is this fitting and proper enough? Louis laughs softly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We belong in hell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what if there is no hell, or they don't want us there? Ever think of that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SAN FRANCISCO - NIGHT The vampire sits in silence, as if tired by his story. Malloy speaks, hesitantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You loved Yvette...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can a vampire feel love?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You loved your wife, surely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was human then. Might as well ask can an angel feel love. Both are blesses or cursed with a certain... detachment. Though whether angels take as long to learn it as I, I will never know. He looks directly at Malloy, shocking him with his gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I loved Yvette. As I loved Pointe Du Lac. And as with each thing I loved, I destroyed it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From the sea, at evening, shrouded in mist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lestat I did not love. And he survived.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A lavish little supper chamber with coffered bed, fancy French furniture. Open to rooftops of colonial city. Louis sits by an open window looking out over the city. Behind, we can hear the laughter of Lestat and tow female voices. Louis turns and sees - Lestat, in the main chamber with two drugged or drunked whores. One runs her finger down his chest. The other seems out of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're skin's icy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not always... He presses his thumb on her neck and holds her tight, sinking his teeth into her neck. After a time she falls to the bed, dead. he turns to the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your friend has no head for wine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's stupid. I can warm that cold skin of yours better than she can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think so? He rubs her breast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why you're warm now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, but the price is pretty high. Your sweet friend - I exhausted her. He bites her in turn, drinks her blood. She does into the swoon. Louis looks on in disgust. He stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm leaving you. I can't stand this any longer. Lestat pulls away from the whore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What, no flowery speeches? About what a monster I am? What a vulgar fiend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not interested in you. You disgust me. I'm interested in my own nature and know I can't trust you to tell me the truth about me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you imagine you are Louis?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't pretend to know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you understand, Louis, that you alone of all creatures can see death with impunity... you alone under the rising moon can strike like the hand of God. The girl moans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lestat, she's alive!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vampires are killers. Predators, who's all seeing eyes were meant to give them detachment. The girl moans again, open her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girl, Lestat -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. Let her alone. He slashes her wrist with his teeth, and lets the blood drip into a glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think you can be human. You think you can go back. But you can't. You live off the blood of rats now Louis. How human is that? The girls moans again. Lestat drinks that glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lie still, love... The girl begins to scream. Lestat picks her up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're tired love, you want to sleep. He walks to his coffin, puts her inside and sits on the lid. We hear muffled screaming and banging from inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you do this Lestat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like to do it. I enjoy it. Take you aesthete's taste to purer things. Kill them swiftly if you will, but do it! For now doubt, you are a killer Louis. Ah! He stands up. The girl pushes the lid off, hysterical. She looks at Louis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a coffin, a coffin! Get me out!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course it's a coffin. You're dead, love. Louis screams at Lestat
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lestat - finish this -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You finish her - if you feel so much - The girl grabs Louis and pleads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't let me die, will you? You'll save me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's too late, love. Look at your wrist, you breast. He picks her up again. He turns to Louis laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unless I make her one of us...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!!!! The girl screams. Louis puts his hands to his ears. Then Lestat, in a fit of pique puts his teeth to her neck. She dies at last. A terrible silence descends. Lestat looks at Louis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God... to think you... are all I have to learn from...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the old world, they called it the dark gift, Louis. And I gave it to you. Louis leaves without a word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A rat scurried down a gutter, then another and another. Louis' hand grabs the rat. We see him from behind, walking down the street, gripping one, then another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I damned? Am I from the devil? Is my very nature that of a devil? And all the while, as these dreaded questions caused me to neglect my thirst, my thirst grew hotter, my veins were threads of pain in my flesh, my temples throbbed. A smaller side street, in which every house is marked with an X. The street is crawling with rats, and Louis is following them. A man passes with a lantern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't go that way Monsieur. It's the plague. Go back the way you came. Louis smiles bitterly at these words, repeating them to himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The way I came... He walks on, following the rats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and finally, when I could stand it no longer, I stood in an empty desolate street and heard the sound of a child crying. A house, the door slightly open, marked with an X. The sound of a child crying inside. Louis walks towards it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little girl, pulling at a figure in a rocking chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mama, please wake up. Mama, I'm frightened, please wake up. As Louis enters, he sees the woman is dead. Her eyes are being eaten away by rats. Louis gasps in horror. Claudia turns. She is a radiant doll or angel as she stretches out her hand to Louis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Monsieur, please help us. Papa's waiting for us at the ship. Please wake mama, Monsieur. She runs to him. Instinctively, he gathers her in his arms. He looks down pitying on her beautiful face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if I am damned, why do I fell such pity for her gaunt face? Why do I wish to warm her tiny arms? Comfort her beating heart? She snuggles into him, suddenly utterly secure. She tugs at his hair, brings his head down towards her. And we see Louis shiver, as his lips go to her neck. Her breathing becomes calm as she goes into the swoon. Gradually another sound replaces it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Suddenly Louis backs away, caught red-handed, the child in his arms. He sees Lestat slapping his knee and laughing in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, my philosopher, my martyr. "Never take a human life". Well you must admit it is funny. Or is it merely touching? I'm not sure. Louis stares at the unconscious Claudia in horror, then lets her slip gently into a chair. Shamefully he wipes his mouth, sees the tiny wounds on her throat. Lestat snatches up the dead mother from the chair and begins to dance with her in great circles, humming and talking. Her head falls back. Black water flows from her mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's make some party of it, shall we? Maybe there's some life in the old lady yet? Louis flees into the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come back, Louis, you are what you are. The plague would have got her within hours anyway. Merciful Death how you love your precious guilt.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: LESTAT'S LAUGHTER, GROWING LOUDER AND LOUDER

direction.raw_text: Louis running through an assortment of streets. All the night life of New Orleans flows by him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For years I had not savored a human. And when I had Lestat's words made sense to me. I knew peace only when I killed and when I heard her heart in that terrible rhythm I knew again what peace could be. Yet even then I could not contenance it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fingers of light in the sky. Louis, pale and shivering, walks splashing through the water. He comes to a huge sewer-pipe, crowded with rats. He crawls inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The same sewer-pipe. Now the bodies of dead rats lie all around. A pair of fine leather boots splash through the water - Lestat's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis huddled there, so pale and shivering he seems close to death. Lestat comes through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All I need to find you Louis is follow the corpses of rats. He bends down to him, surprisingly gently and puts his own coat around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pain is terrible for you. You feel it like no other creature because you are a vampire. You don't want it to go on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... They emerge from the sewer and walk along the waterfront.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do what it is in your nature to do. And you will feel as you felt with that child in your arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God Lestat. I felt peace. I felt an end to the craving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That and more. He puts his arm around Louis, to stop his shivering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evil is a point of view. God kills, indiscriminately, and so shall we. For no creatures under God are as we are, none so like him as ourselves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is God merciless? Greedy and cruel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, but we have even more in common with our creator. come, I am like a mother tonight. I want a child. Louis is baffled. He follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lestat enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's here, your wounded one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you saying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need company, Louis. More congenial than mine... Lestat holds up a candle and walks towards a large four- poster bed. Claudia lies there, angelic, under the coverlet, two marks on her neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lestat!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You remember how you wanted her, the taste of her -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't want to kill her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, Louis, you're conscience is clear. You left her alive. Lestat shakes her gently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claudia, Claudia, listen to me. You're ill, my precious and I'm going to give you what you need to get well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lestat, what do you mean? Louis runs at him, but Lestat brushes him aside effortlessly, so he falls to the floor. Lestat bites his wrist and presses the bleeding wound to the child's mouth... He winces in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it dear. More. You must drink it to get well. Claudia sucks on the wound, reviving, making little noises like a person waking from sleep. Louis rises to his feet as Claudia clutches Lestat's arm, sucking the blood fiercely. Lestat moans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop, that's enough. No more. He pulls her loose and she growls and stares at him with big clear astonished eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What have you done? Lestat puts her down on the bed and sits beside her, holding his wrist, obviously in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, cherie, of course you want more. And I'll show you how to get it. You drink from morals, my beauty, but from me? Never again. Still suffering, Lestat pulls the bell-rope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Being transformed. Becoming white yet robust, bright- eyed yet crazed. She shakes her beautiful curls and the dust falls from them. They are shining in the candlelight. Louis cannot stop looking at her. He does not notices as - The MAID enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, quelle Belle enfant! The maid comes near the bed, kneels in front of Claudia. Lestat lays his hand on the maid's throat and Claudia watches keenly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gently, cherie. They are so innocent. They must not be made to suffer. Claudia lunges for the throbbing vein in the neck, locking on to the flowing blood. The Maid is transfixed. Close on Louis, his anguish, his fascinated horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are the devil! You are the instrument of Satan!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's enough, cherie. Stop before the heart stops. He lets the dead maid onto the floor. Claudia looks at the corpse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want some more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's bet in the beginning, lest the death takes you down with it. yes, that's it. My child. My beloved child. Lestat and Claudia sit on the Louis XVI settee. Claudia is a vision, a doll made out of pearl. Animated, voice crisp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is Mamma? The words echo in Louis' head, as he puts his hands to his ears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mamma's gone to Heaven, cherie, like that sweet lady over there. They all go to Heaven. And you did very well, cherie. Not a drop spilt. Very good! You're going to be our child now. Lestat takes out his comb and begins to comb her hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your mama's left you with us. She wants you to be happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are the devil! You are the instrument of Satan!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shhhh! Do you want to frighten our little daughter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not your daughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes you are, my dearest. You are mine and Louis' daughter. You see Louis was going to leave us. He was going to go away. But now he's not. He's going to stay and make you happy. Claudia runs over to him. She smiles at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lou...eee... Louis is conflicted. He cannot leave her. He touches her cheeks, her hair. Same as his. Vampire skin and hair. He draws in his breath, shocked by her beauty, then he embraces her as a father might a daughter. He looks over her shoulder to Lestat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You fiend. You monster. Lestat smiles
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One happy family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Malloy is open mouthed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A child vampire! He sees the tape has run out. He rapidly and clumsily sticks in another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shall we go on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He did it to make you stay with him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps. He knew me. He knew I would love her more than the waking world. But there was more to it than that. Perhaps in the end he did it - to show me that he could. For he lavished affection on her, there was no doubt about that. Life was very different with madame Claudia, as you can imagine...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (RUE ROYALE, NEW ORLEANS) Two husky movers bring in furniture through the back courtyard, past the fountain and the banana trees, up the back stairs and into -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Striped wallpaper gives way to flowers in the bedrooms. Huge four-poster beds in the bedrooms, and large chests, as big as coffins standing against the wall. Everywhere there are candles and pretty Louis XVI furniture. Lestat gives instructions to the movers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see Claudia draped in lace standing on a petit point chair as a DRESSMAKER measure out a garment. Louis can be seen, in an inner room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Monsieur, I need more light. I shall go slind if you do not bring me a lamp, or let me fit this child during the day. Ouch! She has pricked her hand. A spot of blood appears on her finger Claudia takes her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me kiss it better... Claudia brings the hand to her lips. The dressmaker abruptly pulls her finger away, in pain again.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: WE MOVE INTO A DIMLY LIT PARLOUR

direction.raw_text: - her finger, two holes showing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little child she was, but also a fierce killer, now capable of the ruthless pursuit of blood with all a child's demanding. Lestat walks through - sees the dressmaker lying dead at Claudia's feet, Claudia still on the chair in the half-finished dress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claudia, Claudia, will you never learn? Who will we get now to finish your dress? A little practicality, cherie...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) She would sleep in my coffin, daily, curl her child's fingers round my hair as she dreamt of I know not what... Claudia and Louis, sleeping in a coffin together, Claudia's fingers curling his hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claudia playing with dolls, each as perfect and beautifully dressed as she is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mute and beautiful, she played with dolls, dressing them and undressing them by the hour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claudia tinkling with her child's hands on the piano, picking out a hesitant tune.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mute and beautiful, she killed. And to watch her kill was chilling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The tinkling of Claudia's piano is heard, over - A well-dressed lady, walking through a square lit by gaslight. The lady hears a child's sobbing and stops, turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claudia, the picture of lost innocence, sitting on a bench and crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you crying, child? The woman, all solicitude, goes to Claudia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you lost, my love?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mama...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hush now, don't cry, We'll find her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mama... The woman takes Claudia in her arms. Claudia nestles her head in her shoulder, her teeth near her neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They found death fast in those days, before she learnt to play with the, to delay the moment till she had taken what she wanted...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A stern, stiff PIANO-TEACHER (male) beating time with a ruler as Claudia picks out scales on the piano. He raps her on the knuckles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The thumb girl! Mind the thumb! Claudia glares at him, then returns to playing, improving rapidly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Piano music over. Mozart, now well played. Claudia staring at a glass case, inside of which are an array of eighteenth century dolls. An old DOLLMAKER looks down on her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are expensive, my dear. Maybe too expensive for a young girl like you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claudia walking along, clutching the doll.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dollmaker lying dead, two puncture marks in his throat, his dolls scattered all around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claudia and Louis looking through the window at a display of coffins. Claudia point at the smallest one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She grew, yet stayed the same. She wanted a bed of her own, yet would climb back into mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The child's coffin on the floor. The lid lifts. Claudia emerges, yawning, wanders through the flat into -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where his coffin sits. She slides the lid off, and curls in beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claudia playing the piano, now with remarkable dexterity. The piano-teacher sits mute beside her. As she plays, he topples over and falls to the ground. We see the puncture-marks in his neck. Lestat, hearing the noise, comes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claudia, Claudia! Didn't I tell you, never in the house! Claudia smiles to herself, keeps playing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sing in a cage, above a child's coffin. Claudia is writing at a secretaire. She is writing in a diary with a quill pen in an adult hand. She murmurs the date as she writes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: September 21st, one hour after sunset. The sky is still violet, the way Louis loves and as always Lestat was gone when we rose. She looks up and sees Louis in the doorway, watching her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you learn to write, Claudia?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The way I learn everything. By watching you. She closes the diary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you never let me see you kill, Louis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lestat taught you all you need to know about that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Infant death, he calls me. Sweet daughter death. You know what he calls you? Merciful death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He jests.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why does he call you that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hush, Claudia don't talk about such things. Show me your book. She opens it. Inside there is a beautiful pen and ink portrait of Louis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claudia! You did that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit still. It's not finished - She begins to fill in the sketch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time can pass fast for mortals when they're happy. With us it was the same.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Street lamps are oil at this period. Houses are now tall two-story Spanish style. Streets are flagstone. Passing carriages are black.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a very different life. And a new century was beginning. what had once been a small godforsaken French colony was growing into a great port, giving us an endless train of magnificent strangers... Claudia, Louis and Lestat, dressed in the same clothes walking through a raucous carnival with sideshows. Crowd milling around, sailors, whores, children, thieves, freed slaves, Indians. They pass a Wild West display, jugglers, fire-eaters, three-card tricksters...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All human life was here, for the taking. And we took, all three of us, in our different ways... They come to a raised platform where a troupe of perfectly-formed midgets do a burlesque show. Claudia stops. She stares, at these small, perfect creatures like herself, intrigued and troubled. Louis and Lestat walk on, not noticing as -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Circles the troupe. She comes to a small tent, behind it. At the entrance stands a midget youth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to come inside, lovely? Claudia walks up to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ever been kissed? Claudia shakes her head. He kisses her. Claudia allow her to be kissed, then bites his tongue. he youth struggles, as Claudia holds him and drains him. She lets him go as Louis appears behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's like me, Louis. Small and yet not small at all. Like me. Louis hurriedly draws her away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I watched her grow yet stay the same, her doll-like face possessed of adult eyes, eerie, powerful, seductive...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claudia playing the piano, now like a demonic Liszt. Louis writing. Lestat appears in the doorway. He has a big box in his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another doll? I have ten, you realize.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: early 19th Century French dolls - wood, glass, wax, bisque - all around the bedroom, on chairs, on the bed. Some newish, some tattered old.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I thought you could use another. He hands her the box. It is a fine Parisian Jumeau doll. She likes it and stokes its face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why always on this night?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What night? What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You always give me the doll on the same night of the year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't realize.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this my birthday? He examines the other dolls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some of these are so old and tattered. You should throw them away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have. Or there would be twice as many.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you're the fairest by far.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You dress me like a doll. You make my hair like a doll. Why? Lestat doesn't answer. Claudia stands up quickly, and strides out into the -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where Louis is reading by the window. She walks to a mirrored cabinet, takes out a scissors and begins cutting her hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want me to be a doll forever?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claudia - don't -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not? She continues cutting. She sees Lestat emerge from her bedroom in the mirror behind her then turns to him, an angelic little boy's face now with soft curls around her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't I change, like everybody else? She walks past him, back into her bedroom and slams the door. A beat. Louis looks from the mass of blonde hair on the floor to Lestat. Then a HORRID SCREAM pierces the silence. More screams, which become roars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stands before the dressing-table, all her long hair grown back over her shoulders. She holds it with both hands, screaming and screaming. Lestat and Louis come through the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which of you did it? Which of you made me the way I am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you are? You would be something other than you are?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if I cut my hair again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It will grow back again!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it wasn't always so! I had a mother once! And Louis - he had a wife! He was mortal the same as she! And so was I!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claudia - She turns on Lestat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You made us what we are, didn't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop her Louis!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ???? She runs at him with the scissors, scoring his face. The cut heals. She scores it again. It heals again. She stares at him in horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you do it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And why should I tell you? It's in my power.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why yours alone? Tell me how it was done!!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be glad I made you what you are! You'd be dead not if I hadn't. He storms out. Louis goes to Claudia and picks her up in his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're immortal. You've always known that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me why... you've got to tell me... Louis carries her outside, onto the porch. There is an old flower-seller going by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see the old woman? That will never happen to you. You'll never grow old. You will never die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And it means something else too, doesn't it? I shall never, ever grow up. She clutches Louis desperately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate him. But I cannot bear to lose you. You're the only companion I have, forever. You taught me everything I know. Please tell me Louis. Tell me how it came to be that I am this... thing... Louis strokes her beautiful face, her hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come... I've something to show you...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: CLAUDIA DID YOU DO IT TO ME

direction.raw_text: Louis walking, holding Claudia as if he was about to lose her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Though everything was changed, through the years had warped the contours of the streets, I found my way there, aware that I'd always known where it was and avoided it, not wanting to pass the doorway where I'd first heard Claudia cry. Louis back in the same street, outside the same house. He stands with Claudia at the window. There is a family inside, a picture of domestic tranquility.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard you crying. You were there in a room with your mother. You were hugging her for warmth, crying pitifully as you had been for days. Because your mother was dead... Claudia stares at him, suddenly very cold, very alert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I opened the shutters... I came into the room... I felt pity for you. Pity, but something else. He can't go on. Claudia's eyes are remorseless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You... fed on me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he found me with you. I ran, sickened at what I'd done. Then he cut his wrist and fed you from him. I tried to stop him, but you were a vampire then. And have been every night hereafter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You both did it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I took your life. He gave you another one. Claudia speaks through indrawn breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And here it is. And I hate you both. She runs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Malloy and Louis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But why did you tell her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could I not? She had to know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And did you lose her? Did she go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where would she have gone? She was a child, and beautiful, heartbreaking merciless child. And I had made her that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis, walking the streets, shivering.
direction.name: direction
