direction.raw_text: I walked all night. I walked as I walked years before when my mind swam with guilt at the thought of killing. I found myself at the Cathedral. A cathedral rising out of the mist, the doors open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought of all the things I had done and couldn't undo. And I longed for one second's peace... Louis walks towards the doors, inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis enters. The dim lights of candles. A sacristan tending the altar, an old woman praying - otherwise empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had no fear. If anything I longed for something to happen, for the stones to tremble as I entered the foyer. Louis walking down the nave of the church. He stops by the alter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I almost genuflected from old habit. I almost prayed. Louis sits in a pew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then it struck me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cross, the statues, the tabernacle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if the statues gave an image to nothing? What if I was the supernatural in this cathedral? The only immortal under this roof. And I felt nothing but loneliness. Loneliness to the point of madness. Suddenly a hand is laid on his shoulder. Louis almost jumps. He turns and sees the face of a grey-haired priest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wish to go to confession? I was about to lock up the church. Louis stares at him, tears in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are troubled, aren't you? Can I help?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's too late, too late -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's never too late. Come... The priest gestures to the confessional. Louis rises, slowly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis, kneeling in the darkness. The hatch slides back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bless me father for I have sinned so often and so long, I don't know how to change nor beg for forgiveness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son, God is infinite in his capacity to forgive. Tell him from your heart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Murders, father, death after death. The woman who died two nights ago in Jackson Square, I killed her. And thousands of others before her. I have walked the streets of New Orleans like the Grim reaper. And fed on human life for my own. I am a vampire, father, and have turned the one I love most of all into on too - The hatch slams down. Louis rises, confused, and the door is flung open, the priest stands there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know the meaning of sacrilege? Louis rises. Walks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then there is no mercy. His face comes into the light. The priest steps back, open-mouthed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You talk of sacrilege. Why if God exists does he suffer me to exist? He bares his fangs. The priest runs, screaming. Gets to the bellrope, begins to ring the bell. Louis swoops on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why does he suffer me to live? Louis takes him, lifting him from the floor, till his feet stop kicking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis enters, silently, like a corpse. He hears a voice behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Locked together in hatred - He turns, sees her sitting in the darkness. She is wearing a tiny nightgown of stitched lace and pearls, weirdly adult and seductive. She comes towards him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I can't hate you Louis. She sprays perfume over her body as she comes nearer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this the aroma of a mortal child? She whispers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis. Lover. She kisses his cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was mortal to you. You gave me your immortal kiss. You became my mother and my father. And so I'm yours. Forever. She takes his face in her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But now's the time to end it, Louis. Now's the time to leave him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll never let us go. Claudia smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh... really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A sailing ship, by the docks. Louis and Claudia talking to a shipping-clerk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So we made plans. She was convinced there were others of our kind in Europe, that they would have the answers Lestat couldn't provide. Lestat whom she now hated, who she thought she could be free of. I doubted, but then she had a surprise in store...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lestat playing the piano. Louis reading. Claudia enters, wearing a cape and hat. She walks to the piano, sits at the end of the piano and stares at him as he plays.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it now? You irritate me! Your very presence irritates me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. And I'll tell you something else! I've met someone who will make a better vampire than both of you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that supposed to frighten me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're spoilt because you're an only child. You need a brother. Or I do. I'm weary of you both.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I suppose we could people the world with vampires, the three of us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not you my dear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a liar. But you upset my plans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What plans?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came to make peace with you, even if you're the father of lies. I want things to be as they were. Louis perks up, puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop pestering me then!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Lestat. I must do more than that. I've brought a present for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I hope its a beautiful woman with endowments you will never possess. Claudia stares at him for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better than that. She takes his hand and leads him into an inner room. Louis follows behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You haven't fed enough. I can tell by your color.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two beautiful youths, lying asleep on a couch, by a table full with a half-eaten meal. Lestat sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Claudia, you've outdone yourself. Where did you find them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drunk on brandy wine. A thimbleful. I thought of you when I saw them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We forgive each other then? Claudia stares at him, sitting. She nods. Lestat bites into the neck of one of the youths, sucks greedily and horribly. Claudia watches him without expression. He finished one, is about to take the other when he staggers. He looks at Claudia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absinthe? You gave them absinthe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Laudanum. Lestat stares wildly at her, tries to move towards her, then slips to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laudanum!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. It killed them, unfortunately. But it keeps the blood warm. Lestat tries to rise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah Louis, Louis, she killed them... and let me drink... Louis watches, appalled. He goes to move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't Louis -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis, put me in my coffin...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll put you in your coffin. Forever. She pulls a knife out from under her shawl, walks rapidly to him and slashes his throat. Blood explodes from it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claudia! Don't do this thing!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis, Louis, I gave you the gift - help me - Claudia lacerates his face. Blood pours from everywhere. She plunges the knife in his chest. He falls back, fangs bared, clutching the knife. Claudia leaps on him then, bites deep into his neck as he dies. Louis screams, runs forward, pulls her away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What have you done, Claudia - He drags her off Lestat, tries to pull her out of the room. She hisses at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis! Look what's happening to him!! Louis looks. The floor is a sea of blood. Lestat has begun to shrivel, as if he'd been a bag of blood. His skin is shriveling against his bones like parchment, his eyes are slipping back into his skull-like face. His lush, beautiful hair remains unchanged. But his clothes are virtually being emptied of the body. It is no more than bones, wrapped in paper and the pupils of the eyes suddenly roll up into the papered skull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lestat. Oh, God forgive us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't mock me, Louis. Help me. She stares at the shriveled skeleton in its skin wrapping. She is fascinated. She sees the vampiric blood flow all over the floor. She touches it and brings her finger to her lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodnight, sweet prince, may flights of devils wing you to your rest. Louis walks forward, touches the skeleton, the blonde hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's dead, Claudia, dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The one good lesson he taught me, Louis. Never drink from the dead. She stands up, all business suddenly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help me. We must get rid of him. She drags the coverlet from the table, knocking the crockery over the dead youths, and wraps Lestat's skeleton in it. She takes a bunch of chrysanthemums and places them in his skeleton hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing if not vampires...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who made us what we are?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Surely you know the one who made you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the one who made him, who made the one who made him, the source of all this evil... Louis looks at the picture. Armand watches him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is a picture, nothing more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean we are not children of Satan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. He smiles at Louis. A smile of infinite compassion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand. I saw you in the theatre, your suffering, your sympathy for that girl. I saw you with the boy. You die when you kill, you feel you deserve to die and you stint on nothing. But does that make you evil? Or, since you comprehend what you call goodness, does it not make you good?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then there is nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps... He passes his finger through the candle flame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And perhaps this is the only real evil left...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then God does not exist...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have not spoken to him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And no vampire here has discourse with God or the Devil?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: None that I've ever known. I know nothing of God or the Devil, I have never seen a vision nor learnt a secret that would damn or save my soul. And as far as I know, after four hundred years I am the oldest living vampire in the world. He stares at them, his face angelic, hypnotic, young. His eyes hold them both in a trance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God... So it's as I always feared. Nothing, leading to nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You fell too much. So much you make me feel... He stares from Claudia to Louis. He seems to be reading their souls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The one who made you should have told you this. The one who left the old world for the new...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He knew nothing. He just didn't care.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Knew? You mean he is... Claudia appears suddenly to Louis' shoulder, interrupting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come, beloved. It's time we were on our way. I'm hungry and the city waits. She stares hard at Armand. Armand looks from her to Louis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So soon to go? He seems genuinely regretful. But Claudia pulls Louis out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis and Claudia feel their way through darkened corridors, trying to find their way out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The place was dark as we left, a darkness that confounded even Claudia. And as we blundered through it, again came the thought: I have wronged Lestat, I have hated him for the wrong reasons. Suddenly a light comes on. They see they are in the empty theatre. Santiago stands on the stage, under a candle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you wrong him? Louis is stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You read my thoughts?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said a name -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A name I don't want to say again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I seemed to recognize it... Other vampires appear behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is but one crime among us vampires here. He looks at Claudia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should know, who are so secretive about the vampire who made you. Claudia laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boredom!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is the crime that means death to any vampire. To kill your own kind!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aaaah! I was so afraid it was to be born like Venus out of the foam, as we were! Come Louis, let's go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claudia and Louis enter the Lobby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I loathe them! I can't stand the sight of them! Stupid bourgeois Parisians, all dressed in black like some private club! I've searched for them the world over and I despise them!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What danger?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can feel it from them! They want to know who made us, what became of him. They have their rules, their idiotic rules! They come to their room, enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis closes the door behind him. Claudia paces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think I would let them harm you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you would not, Louis. Danger hold you to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Love holds you to me. And we are in danger, not you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Love? She smiles at him. A strange, sad, adult smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You would leave me for Armand if he beckoned you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wants you as you want him. He's been waiting for you. He wants you for a companion. He bides his time that place. he finds them as dull and lifeless as we do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know what his soul said to me without saying a word? When he put me in that trance...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you felt it too!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let him go, he said. Let him go. She touches his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that what I should do Louis? Let you go? My father? My lover? My Louis, who made me? There are tears in her eyes. Louis lifts her up in his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can protect us, Claudia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really believe that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claudia, staring at the dolls. We see Madeleine inside, painting a doll. She sees Claudia and smiles and waves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis, sitting alone in the box, as the curtains draw back, to show Santiago as death, as before. Louis takes advantage of the darkness to slip away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Armand opens the door to Louis' knock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was waiting for you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to me. He follows Armand into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claudia is dear to me. My... daughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your lover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, my beloved, my child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you say so. You are innocent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not innocent. But I'm afraid. She feels she's in danger from the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could give you reasons. Her silence. Her youth. It's forbidden to make so young, so helpless, that cannot survive on its own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then blame the one who made her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you kill this vampire who made you both? Is that why you won't say his name? Santiago thinks you did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We want no quarrel with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's already begun. If you want to save her, send her away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I leave too. Armand smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So soon? Without any of those answers you so longed for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said there were none.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you asked the wrong questions. Do you know how few vampires have the stamina for immortality? How quickly they perish of their own will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You would never give up life. If the world were reduced to one empty cell, on fragile candle, you stay alive and study it. You see too clearly. You see too much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what the one who made me said.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How he must have loved you. Armand suddenly grips Louis close to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis, I need you more than he ever did. I need a link with this century. The world changes. We do not. Therein lies the irony that ultimately kills us. I need you to make contact with this age. Louis laughs bitterly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He? Don't you see? I'm not the spirit of any age! I'm at odds with everything and always have been! I'm not even sure what I am! Armand smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Louis, that is the very spirit of your age. The heart of it. You fall from grace has been the fall of a century. Louis is stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the vampires of the Theatre?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like moths around the candle of the age. Decadent, useless. They can't reflect anything. But you do. You reflect its broken heart. Louis is speechless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are these not the answers you came for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... My God...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A vampire with a human soul. An immortal with a mortal's passion. You are beautiful, my friend. Lestat must have wept when he made you -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lestat! You knew Lestat!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes I knew him. Knew him well enough not to mourn his passing. Armand stands. He takes Louis by the arm, leads him towards the back wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you must go now. You must get her safely out of Paris. He opens a hidden door in the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No-one else knows of this door. When you knock you will find me waiting...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis, in the street outside, as the door closes behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I felt a kind of peace at last. I had found the teacher which Lestat could never, I knew now, have been. I knew knowledge would never be withheld by Armand. It would pass through him as through a pane of glass. And I knew Claudia must leave me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis enters. There is unfamiliar scent in the air, a doll sitting by the mirror. Louis looks in the mirror and sees...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The doll-maker, resplendent in green taffeta, sitting like a Madonna with Claudia on her lap. Claudia's arms are wound round her neck. The contrast between mortal woman and immortal child is plain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Madeleine... Louis is shy. Madeleine rises and comes towards Louis. She draws back the lace fringes round her throat, so he can see the two marks there. She says softly, dreamily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drink. Louis turns away. Claudia speaks, icy, from the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do it Louis. Because I cannot do it. I haven't the strength. You saw to that when you made me. Louis turns to Madeleine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You haven't the vaguest conception under God of what you ask!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Au contraire, monsieur, I have. Louis pushes her away. Claudia screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have found your new companion, Louis! You will make me mine! Louis grips Madeleine and shakes her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do we seem to you? Do you think us beautiful, magical, our white skin, our fierce eyes? Drink, you ask me! Have you any idea of the thing you will become?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your evil is that you cannot be evil! And I will suffer for it no longer!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't make me, Claudia! I cannot do it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yet you could do it to me! Snatching me from my mother's hands like two monsters in a fairy-tale! Couldn't you have waited? Six more years and I would have had that shape! And now you weep! You haven't tears enough for what you've done to me. She points to Madeleine
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You give her to me! Do this before you leave me! She begins to weep, sobbing like a child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God! I love you still, that's the torment of it. But you know I must leave you Louis...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And who will care for me my love, my dark angel, when you are gone? Louis looks at Madeleine
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You promise to care for her then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you know what you ask for? She wraps her arms around Claudia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think she is, Madeleine? A doll?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A child who can't die... Her finger clutches a locket around her neck, Louis touches it, opens it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A picture of a young girl, Claudia's age, wistful, beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the child who did die?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My daughter... Louis takes her chin in his hand, gently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at the gaslight. Don't take your eyes off it. You will be drained to the point of death, but you must stay alive. Do you hear me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes! Louis pulls her to him and starts to drink her blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis on the balcony, weakened terribly. A breeze blows on the gauze curtains behind him, through which we see...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Madeleine and Claudia. Madeleine her arms outstretched, now a vampire, a long moan of pain coming from her. Claudia comes through the curtains, alarmed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis! Louis speaks without turning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is dying. It happened to you too, but your child's mind can't remember.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But if she dies...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's only mortal death. He turns to look at Claudia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bear me no ill will, my love. We are now even.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What died tonight inside that room was not that woman. It will take her many nights to die, perhaps years. What has died in that room tonight is the last vestige in me of what was human. She takes his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes father. At last. We are een. He bends down and kisses her. He looks up, at the wafting curtains. He sees -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Silhouetted, coming closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks up and screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are ripped aside. The vampires of the Theatre surge through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time for justice, little one. The vampires close on them as Louis struggles, Claudia's scream pierces the night air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a press of vampires, Louis, Claudia and Madeleine are forced down the dark corridor. Into -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vampire chaos, as they are dragged through. Louis struggling like a demon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Armand! Get me Armand! he wouldn't countenance this -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can make no demands here! Buffoon! Bastard - Santiago strikes Louis to the ground. As he struggles to his feet, he sees the vampires part around a figure coming through. He gasps at the sight of -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dressed beautifully, but horribly scarred now, from the fire as well as the earlier stabbing. Lestat is confused, ancient, teetering, reaching for Santiago's shoulder to steady himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he the one? Lestat shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, the child. The child was the one...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All the murderers!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are alive, Lestat! It can't be murder! Tell them how you treated us... Lestat reaches out to Louis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... You come back to me Louis...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you mad???
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sentence is death! To all of them!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only the girl - it was the girl - The sound of something being dragged through the crowd. Horrible echoing, scraping - Lestat grips Santiago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You promised me - I could take him back to New Orleans - Louis - there's something I must tell you - about that night - that night I met you - He stares around him, confused. The scraping gets louder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You let her go, Lestat - you let her free - and I'll come back with you - Santiago grabs Louis by the neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Death for the others. For you eternity in a box - We see now what caused the scraping. A huge metal coffin being dragged through the vampires. Claudia screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walled in a dungeon. Your only company will be your screams... Perhaps it will take centuries... The vampires grab Louis. They force him towards the coffin. Lestat struggles with them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's coming home with me - you promised -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We promised nothing! Louis struggles fiercely as he is forced into the coffin. Claudia weeps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've fooled you, Lestat! You must reach Armand! Armand has the power! Louis, struggling in the coffin. Then the lid is forced down, huge locks closed over it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis, in the smallest imaginable space. Beating his forehead against the metal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claudia, throwing herself on the coffin, crying. She is dragged away. Vampire hands drag the coffin across the stone floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis, forehead pouring with blood, being thrown this way and that. The coffin is lifted, upside down, Louis' head crashes off the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is thrust into a niche in the wall. Bricks being placed over, mortar trowelled on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis upside down. Sounds of bricks and mortar. Then terrifying, unearthly scream pierces the coffin, striking to his very soul.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claudia!!! He loses consciousness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COFFIN Louis sleeps, upside down. Sound of bricks being broken, thrown aside. Then of locks breaking. Louis opens his eyes. The lid opens. He sees -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Above him, reaching down to take his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurry. Don't make a sound. Louis gets out, into a vast long catacomb. Louis runs to the end of it, steps through a broken brick wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is she? Where's Claudia?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Follow me - that way - through my cell - He points to his cell at the end of the passage, the foot of the steps. Sound of rain beyond the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not without Claudia. Where is she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't save her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't believe I'd leave without her. Armand! You must save her! You have no choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis, I can't save her. I will only risk losing you - Louis runs up the stone stairs. It leads to the ballroom. He enters. Estelle stands far off, looking at him coolly. She lifts the stage skull mask and laughs softly behind it. A male vampire slumps in a chair staring softly at Louis. Silence. Indifference. Louis sees Lestat sitting in a far corner. he rushes up to Lestat, who looks up at him, confused. He's holding something crumpled, made of cloth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll come home with me Louis? For a little while... until I am myself again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!! Louis turns round and round in rage. Passive still faces. A door bangs open and shut. Louis looks again at Lestat. He snatches the cloth from Lestat's hand. We see it is a small torn bloodstained dress. Claudia's dress. The door bangs again. Estelle laughs. Rain gusts into the ballroom. Louis goes to the door, holding the dress. Armand approaches, trying to pull him away, but Louis shrugs him off. He draws nearer and nearer and stairs at -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the stones lie Claudia and Madeleine, burn to ashes, in each other's arms, like the corpses of his wife and daughter in the New Orleans graveyard, embracing each other. Only Claudia's blond hair and Madeleine's red hair remain unburnt. Louis looks up at the walls of this airwell, many stories to the sky. He cries out in agony. Santiago appears behind him, staring. Louis roars in horror and attacks Santiago, scattering the ashes into the rainy wind. Claudia's golden locks fly up into the wind, they whirl around the warring figure. Armand appears, drags Louis free, pulls him screaming from the airwell, into the ballroom, towards the exit. Claudia's hair is sucked up by the wind through the airwell, towards the night sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis is slumped against the stone wall. Armand stands beside him like a guardian angel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't prevent it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe you. I do not have to read your soul to know that you lie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis, they cannot be brought back. There are some things that are impossible, even for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You let them do it. Louis climbs to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You held sway over them. They feared you. You wanted it to happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis, I swear I did not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand you only too well. You let them do it, as I let Lestat turn a child into a demon. As I let her rip Lestat's heart to pieces! Well I am no longer that passive fool that has spun evil from evil till the web traps the one who made it. Your melancholy spirit of this century! I know what I must do. And I warn you - you saved me tonight, so I return the favor - do not go near your cell in the Theatre Des Vampires again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wet and deserted, the streets around the theatre are quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chiming five a.m.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looking at the paling sky. He is in an alleyway, outside of Armand's cell. He has a huge keg with him. he finds the door unlocked. He enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Empty. The hearth is cold. The old coffin is gone. Louis silently closes the door to the passage and blocks it with an immense bar. He goes in the other door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis hurls kerosene all over the stage, the curtain, the sets, the seats below. He grabs the scythe from the playlet. He walks out. Dribbling a trail of kerosene behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis walking rapidly down, leaving the trail of kerosene. He creeps quietly into the -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leaking kerosene from the cask. He splashes over the coffins that gleam in the dimness. Then he strikes a match and heaves it into the kerosene. Everything bursts into flame. The trail of kerosene roars into fire through the ballroom over the coffins and up the stairs. We hear EXPLOSIONS of fire from above.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shudders all over, fighting the morning weakness. He readies the scythe, like the grim reaper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rises from her burning coffin, screams and tries to run through the fire but Louis slashes her down with the scythe and she goes down screaming, her dress in flames.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop him. It's morning. The sunlight. Stop him. Others rise, choking in the smoke. Screams from everywhere. They are burning. Louis backs up the stairs to the -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can see there a thin pale light under Armand's bolted door. Suddenly -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Comes at him from behind. Louis turns. Santiago rushes him in a blur. Louis swings the scythe, too fast to see what he himself is doing. Santiago's head streaming blood flies through the air. The body drops, flapping its arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: come from everywhere. Another vampire rushes burning towards Louis. He decapitates him in turn. Then he staggers into Armand's cell, and bars the door the connects it to the ballroom behind him. He staggers to the outer door. There is a thin strip of daylight, beneath the door, blinding him. He throws it open, and staggers into the daylight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis staggers out of the burning theatre, into the thin daylight. Great gusts of smoke cover the street. He staggers through the daylight, weakening, about to fall, when through the clouds of smoke comes -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As in a dream, driven by Armand's human boy. The door of the hearse opens. Through the curtains enclosing the interior, we see Armand. He reaches a hand out to Louis and pulls him inside. The hearse vanishes through the smoke, leaving the spectacle of the burning theatre.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The gutted Theatre and ballroom, the roof collapsed, exposed to the evening sky. The life of Paris goes on around it, oblivious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is already a museum by this time and Louis and Armand, fancily dressed and composed, walk through it. They stop by a Gericault - The Wreck of the Medusa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't even warm them, did you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And yet you knew what I would do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew. I rescued you, didn't I? From the terrible dawn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were their leader. They trusted you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You made me see their failings, Louis. You made me look at them with your eyes. He looks at Louis affectionately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your melancholy eyes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a pair we are. We deserve each other, don't we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are a pair, and that's what counts. Armand and Louis walk slowly through the Louvre together. Camera follows them for a while, then comes to rest on a sunrise by Turner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We left Paris shortly after. For years we wandered. Greece, Egypt, all the ancient lands. Then, out of curiosity, perhaps, boredom, who knows what, I took him home, to my America...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A deco cinema of the twenties. Louis and Armand, dressed in the style of the period walk down the aisle through the crowded seats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And there, a technological wonder allowed me see sunrise, for the first time in two hundred years... On the screen, Murnau's "Sunrise", in black and white. We see a montage of sunrises, from a whole range of movies, in black and white.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what sunrises! Seen as the human eye could never see them. We would sit in the dark, night after night among nameless humans, entranced with the miracle of light. Silver at first, then as the years progressed in tones of purple, red and my long-lost blue... The SUNRISES continue, in color now, and the backgrounds in them change to the fifties.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And in time parted. We had become so alike, we both wanted the certainties of loneliness once more. The lights come up in a different theatre. Louis sitting there, alone, in a half empty theatre, dressed in the clothes of the fifties. He rises, exits with the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cars rushing by, twentieth-century madness. Louis emerges from the theatre, walks through the streets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had returned to new Orleans. As soon as I smelt the air, I knew I was home. There was sadness there, rich, almost sweet, like the fragrance of jasmine. I walked the streets, savoring it like a long lost perfume...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis walks past the many Greek Revival Mansions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then on Prytania Street, only blocks from the Lafayette cemetery I caught the scent of death and it wasn't coming from the graves...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S OVER white-walled Lafayette cemetery and its surrounding mansions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The scent grew stronger as I walked. Old death. A scent too faint for mortals to detect. Louis sees rats darting across the street. They rush into a great overgrown garden surrounding a ruined mansion. No lights. Louis stops at a rusted gate. He forces it open and enters -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of overgrown rose and oak tree and wisteria. he sees a faint glimmer of light coming from a distant glass window of a huge Greek Revival house. He approaches then he sees -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of a man, long dead and dried up, snagged in the thorny rosevines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks around. Walks on. Sees another corpse, almost nothing but bones, sinking into the wet earth, the roots of an oak overgrowing it. He looks up at the distant light. He passes a third corpse, caught in wisteria and rose vine, only bones and clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were like the doomed princess caught in the thorny vines of Sleeping Beauty's castle. I knew what it meant. A vampire had lured them here, but had been to weak to get rid of them. Louis sees dead rats lying near the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It spelt weakness, madness, the behavior of a dying animal that pollutes its own lair. Louis treads carefully on the rotted steps. he moves along the porch. More dead rats. He sees through the floor-length window into rooms lined with stacked books. Virtually walled with them. Water seeps down from the ceiling, gleaming as it streaks over the books. The floors of the splendid rooms are bare, except for a rotten French chair by a dead fireplace. A single mirror reflecting the moon. Dead rats. He moves along the porch to the parlor windows. The candle flickers inside. He sees -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lestat lying on the floor. He is gaunt to near starvation. All his scars are gone, but he is almost a skeleton and his eyes are enormous in their sockets. His clothes are rags. Blond hair beautiful, as always.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Lestat escaped the fire!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hadn't even been there. And all those years I thought he was dead.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: MALLOY'S ENTRANCES FACE SUPERIMPOSED OVER MALLOY

direction.raw_text: One tiny candle stands beside him. He reads an early comic, from the turn of the century. Without turning his head, he speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so glad you're here Louis... I've dreamed of your coming...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't try to speak... it's alright...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't mean to let them do it... that Santiago, he tricked me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all past, Lestat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Past... she should never have been one of us... He turns and looks at Louis. Old, fearful, broken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still beautiful Louis. You always were the strong one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't fear me, Lestat. I bring you no harm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've come back to me, Louis? You've come again to me? Louis shakes his head. A series of police sirens go by, piercing the night sky. A helicopter goes overhead. Red flashes illuminate his face. Lestat shivers, covers his ears. He's terrified. Louis touches him, calming him, until the lights pass over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's only a siren...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't bear it Louis! The machines out there, that fly and that roar! And such lights! They make the night brighter than the day!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And they frighten you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know I love the dark. But there's no dark anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's false light, Lestat. It can't harm you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you stayed with me Louis, I could venture out... little by little... become the old Lestat. Louis shivers. He releases him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to go now Lestat...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You remember how I was, Louis.. the vampire Lestat...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. I remember... Lestat shivers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tried to tell you Louis... that night in Paris... when I first came to you... no-one can refuse the dark gift, Louis... not even you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tried...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the more you tried, the more I wanted you... a vampire with your beautiful, suffering human heart. And how you suffered... I need your forgiveness, Louis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have it... Louis walks slowly away from him. Lestat turns back to his candle, his magazine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll come back, Louis... take me out... little by little... and maybe I'll be myself again... A bluebottle buzzes by him. His hand shoots out and grabs it, squeezes the blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Lestat...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he walks through the decayed house. His eyes are expressionless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And my story ends there. But in fact it ended a long time ago, with Claudia's ashes in that theatre. My love died with her. I never really changed after that. What became of Lestat I have no idea. I go on, night after night. I feed on those who cross my path. But all my passion went with her yellow hair. I ma a spirit with preternatural flesh. Detached. unchangeable. Empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SAN FRANCISCO - NIGHT (PRESENT) Malloy, staring at Louis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... it can't end like that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it has. There is no more to tell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you talk about passion, about longing, about things I'll never know in my life! It's still inside you, in every syllable you speak! And then you tell me it ends like that? Just empty?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's over, I'm telling you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need a new passion, Louis, a new reason to feel... what a story you've told, you don't understand yourself. Louis looks at the cassettes on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do what you want with it. Learn what you can. Give the story to others. Malloy rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have another chance, Louis. Take me! Give me your gift, your power... Louis is slowly horrified, then outraged and angry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this what you want? You ask me for this after all I've told you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I could see what you've seen, feel what you've felt I wouldn't let it end like this! You need a like to the world out there, a connection... then it won't end like this... He stares at Louis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need me. Louis turns away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dear God. I've failed again, haven't I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't say anymore. The reels are still turning. I have but one chance to show you the meaning of what I've said. He looks at the boy. Then suddenly grabs him, lifts him off the floor, bares his terrifying fangs and brings them to his throat. Malloy screams, in involuntary terror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You like it? You like being food for the immortals? You like dying? Is it beautiful? Is it intense? Malloy, now terrified, whispers
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... please... Louis drops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank God. Malloy, falls on the floor, terrified. When he looks up, Louis has vanished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louis... Louis... He looks up at the tape. It is still turning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy shit... He shakes his head. He gets up, and with shaking fingers gathers his tapes. He runs out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Malloy running for his car, a convertible. He leaps in and screeches off through the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Malloy whips the car through the tiny streets, in sheer, unfocused terror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Malloy driving with streams of traffic over the bridge. He breathes deeply, to calm himself. He takes a tape from his pocket, and with still shaking hands, sticks it in the deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . That's when it happened. I was twenty-four. Younger then you are now. Suddenly a bony hand shoots out from the back seat, pulls his neck backwards -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sinks his teeth in his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the wheel, shaking, shuddering, losing their grip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bulging, as the life drains out of him. Lestat sucking him like a rat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swinging free of Malloy's dying hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Veers wildly into oncoming traffic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drinks regardless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coming towards them, about to crush the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grabs the wheel, jerks it as he drinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Misses the truck by inches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Throws Malloy to one side, climbs into the front seat. The tape is playing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My invitation was open to anyone. Sailors, whores, thieves. But it was a vampire that accepted...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the wheel, the corpse of Malloy in the passenger seat. He smiles. We can see the blood renewing him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dear Louis... will I ever forget?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lestat drives on, the car a tiny speck against the bridge, the sea, the sky beyond, with the first fingers of light spreading through it.
direction.name: direction
